name: a(n) = A003266(n)^2.
comment: For n>=3 number of valid symmetrical change ringing methods on n bells with the shortest number of rows per lead where the treble plain hunts out to the back. See Wikipedia and the Polster, Ross link for an explanation of bell ringing terminology.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..70
Richard Duckworth and Fabian Stedman, Tintinnalogia, or, the Art of Ringing, (1671). Released by Project Gutenberg, 2006.
Burkard Polster and Marty Ross, Ringing the changes, (2009).
Index entries for sequences related to bell ringing
mathematica: k = 1; {1, 1}~Join~Reap[Do[k *= Fibonacci[n]; Sow[k^2], {n, 16}] ][[-1, 1]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 14 2025 *)
author: _Edwin Hermann_, Apr 08 2025
